p.s: The article is written by Joachim Neubauer and published in a regional newspaper from Cologne.
It's about the KLS goes green project at my school.
It was one day we had to choose between about 40 different workshops we're interested in the workshops are for example how to use water environment-friendly.
The teacher Peter Clemens says it was also used to push the political interest of the students which grow up a lot because of Fridays for Future.
Students, parents and teachers worked together to create the workshops.
Clemens also says it's important to give the students the feeling of having influence on politics, because without that feeling the interest disappears fast.
Neubauer interviewed two girls who sold vegan waffles, cakes and fair-trade coffee in order to show that it is delicious too.
The girls said it made them happy to do somethign for an important goal.
Also two poetry-slam-artistspoetry-slam artists visited our school on this day and one of thme also made a workshop where the kids can practice their voice and language.
Peter Clemens the KLS goes green project was succesful because the students worked verey well in the workshops and he thinks to repeat this project can be a good idea.
